## Tester Onboarding Checklist

Use this checklist for each confirmed beta tester:

### [ ] Initial Contact
- [ ] Send welcome email with program overview
- [ ] Provide download link for v0.1.0-alpha
- [ ] Share BETA_PROGRAM_GUIDE.md
- [ ] Add to mailing list
- [ ] Send feedback form link

### [ ] Installation Verification
- [ ] Confirm they've installed HyperBox
- [ ] Verify `hb --version` works
- [ ] Troubleshoot any installation issues
- [ ] Confirm crun/runc is available

### [ ] Orientation
- [ ] Send GitHub Issues template links
- [ ] Explain feedback submission process
- [ ] Clarify communication channels
- [ ] Provide troubleshooting guide
- [ ] Schedule first check-in

### [ ] First Activity
- [ ] Confirm they've run first container
- [ ] Answer initial questions
- [ ] Provide technical support
- [ ] Celebrate their participation
- [ ] Add to Hall of Fame (pending)

## Outreach Email Templates

### Template 1: Initial Recruitment Email

```
Subject: Join the HyperBox Beta Testing Program - 20x Faster Docker Alternative

Hi [Name],

We're excited to invite you to participate in the HyperBox beta testing program!

HyperBox is a revolutionary Docker Desktop alternative that's:
- 20x faster (100ms vs 30-140s container startup)
- Open source (MIT licensed)
- Built in Rust for maximum performance
- Ready for your feedback and contributions

We're looking for 10-20 beta testers to help shape the future of container tools.

As a beta tester, you'll get:
‚úÖ Early access to all features
‚úÖ Recognition in our Hall of Fame
‚úÖ Direct influence on the product roadmap
‚úÖ Support from the core team

Ready to join? Here's how:

1. Download from: https://github.com/iamthegreatdestroyer/HyperBox/releases/tag/v0.1.0-alpha
2. Follow installation guide for your platform
3. Try: hb --version
4. Share feedback via GitHub Issues or Discussions

Questions? We're here to help!

Full program guide: [Link to BETA_PROGRAM_GUIDE.md]

Looking forward to your participation!

Best regards,
The HyperBox Team
```

### Template 2: Follow-up Email (No Response)

```
Subject: A Second Look - HyperBox Beta Testing

Hi [Name],

I wanted to follow up on our previous email about the HyperBox beta testing program.

I understand you might be busy, but we'd love to have you on board if you're interested:

- It only takes 2-5 hours per week
- No experience required - we'll guide you through everything
- Your feedback directly shapes the product
- You'll be recognized as a founding contributor

If you're interested, just reply to this email or join our GitHub Discussions:
https://github.com/iamthegreatdestroyer/HyperBox/discussions

If now isn't the right time, no problem! Feel free to reach out when you're ready.

Thanks,
The HyperBox Team
```

## Response & Support Protocol

### Response Times (SLA)

| Issue Type | Target Response | Owner |
|------------|-----------------|-------|
| Installation problems | 4 hours | Dev Team |
| Bug reports | 24 hours | Product Manager |
| Feature requests | 48 hours | Product Manager |
| General questions | 24 hours | Community Manager |
| Security concerns | 2 hours | Core Team Lead |

### Escalation Path

1. **Community Manager** - Initial triage and response
2. **Product Manager** - Complex issues or decisions
3. **Development Lead** - Technical deep-dive or critical bugs
4. **Core Lead** - Security or major decisions

---

## Conflict Resolution

### Common Issues & Resolution

**Issue:** Tester reports bug that doesn't reproduce
- **Action:** Ask for detailed reproduction steps
- **Escalation:** Have another team member try to reproduce
- **Resolution:** Create investigation task if critical, mark as "needs-more-info" if not

**Issue:** Tester becomes inactive
- **Action:** Send friendly check-in email after 2 weeks inactivity
- **Escalation:** Personal reach out after 4 weeks
- **Resolution:** Remove from active roster if no response after 6 weeks

**Issue:** Tester has negative tone or attitude
- **Action:** Remind of Code of Conduct
- **Escalation:** Private conversation with community manager
- **Resolution:** Remove if violations continue

**Issue:** Tester reports false or irrelevant issues repeatedly
- **Action:** Provide feedback on issue quality
- **Escalation:** Discuss expectations
- **Resolution:** Warning then removal if pattern continues
